Guard.synopsis: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.
Guard.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto -100.475; 9.281; 431.4254. Talk with Gribbo

Volo_FestivitiesArea.synopsis: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.

Volo_Massacre.synopsis: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.

Volo_InCage.synopsis: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.
Volo_InCage.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. oe debugbook7>2>4>3>24. goto 330 -85. Talk to voloNote: to open the cage, either pick the lock or kill the guard and take the key

Guard_AtCage.synopsis: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The sessions revolve around the character Volo being captured by goblins and the interactions that occur around this scenario. 'Guard' and 'Guard_AtCage' both involve the same goblin character, suggesting they may be different states of the same scenario. 'Volo_InCage' must precede both 'Guard' and 'Guard_AtCage' as Volo is in a cage needing help before any guard interaction can take place. 'Volo_FestivitiesArea' and 'Volo_Massacre' describe similar situations where Volo is being forced to sing, but they likely represent different outcomes depending on player actions, thus they are mutually exclusive with each other. If the player engages in the festivities and does not intervene, it would lead to 'Volo_FestivitiesArea', while if they intervene and kill the goblins, they would trigger 'Volo_Massacre'.

Guard_0.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_0.context: NodeContext: Volo is gone; Guard has no real function so is just a mean, stupid drunk.

Volo_FestivitiesArea_41.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_41.text:
With fragulous crown, and with sceptre abrade,
Dror Ragzlin short work of the innkeeper made!
Volo_FestivitiesArea_41.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'fragulous' has a hard 'g' to sound somewhat like 'fabulous'. 'abrade' is pronounced a-braid. Dror Ragzlin is 'Drawer RAGS-lin'

Volo_FestivitiesArea_38.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_38.text:
The inn burned to ash! The captives were many!
Goblinkind had reduced them to cowering filfenny!
Volo_FestivitiesArea_38.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'filfenny' pronounced 'filth-any'

Volo_FestivitiesArea_56.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_56.text:
So raiseth your goblets, and drain them with pride!
Dror Ragzlin, the True Soul, hath led you galide!
Volo_FestivitiesArea_56.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'Dror Ragzlin' is the goblins' leader (pronounced 'Drawer RAGS-lin'), 'galide' is a nonsense word pronounced with a hard 'g' (Gah-lied)

Volo_FestivitiesArea_44.speaker: Wyll
Volo_FestivitiesArea_44.text: I reckon Dror Ragzlin's the gobbo in charge, the way this one's carrying on.

Volo_FestivitiesArea_35.speaker: Gribbo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_35.context: NodeContext: Common is a language - can't believe she's having to explain this

Volo_FestivitiesArea_14.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_14.text: Quite so. Now if you'll excuse me.
Volo_FestivitiesArea_14.context: NodeContext: trying to smooth things over during an argument

Volo_FestivitiesArea_24.speaker: Gribbo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_24.text: Whozzat? Friend o' yours? You up to somethin'?
Volo_FestivitiesArea_24.context: NodeContext: talking to Volo rather than the player - confused, thinks there's a scheme going on

Volo_FestivitiesArea_53.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_53.context: NodeContext: a loudly whispered aside to the player while under duress

Volo_FestivitiesArea_54.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_54.context: NodeContext: trying to get his bearings after being interrupted on stage

Volo_FestivitiesArea_36.speaker: Gribbo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_36.text: Wait a tick. That a friend o' yours?

Volo_FestivitiesArea_25.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_25.context: NodeContext: indignant - trying to smooth over an argument

Volo_FestivitiesArea_11.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_11.text: No! I mean, I... we've met, but only for the briefest of consultations.
Volo_FestivitiesArea_11.context: NodeContext: trying to smooth over an argument by insisting he doesn't know the player well

Volo_FestivitiesArea_5.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_5.text: (What are you doing? I'm busy here!)

Volo_FestivitiesArea_7.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_7.context: NodeContext: trying to distract from an argument

Volo_FestivitiesArea_9.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_9.text: Ahem. 'Dror Ragzlin, Dror Ragzlin, we, erm...'
Volo_FestivitiesArea_9.context: NodeContext: attempting to return to his improvised song - projecting voice uncertainly on and after Dror Ragzlin (Drawer RAGS-lin

Volo_FestivitiesArea_30.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_30.text: I, erm... 'Dror Ragzlin, umtumptous, Dror Ragzlin, erm...'
Volo_FestivitiesArea_30.context: NodeContext: attempting to return to his improvised song - projecting voice uncertainly on and after Dror Ragzlin (Drawer RAGS-lin

Volo_FestivitiesArea_34.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_34.text: Wait! Wait! 'Dror Ragzlin, we... pray... we...'
Volo_FestivitiesArea_34.context: NodeContext: attempting to return to his improvised song - projecting voice uncertainly on and after Dror Ragzlin (Drawer RAGS-lin

Volo_FestivitiesArea_0.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_0.context: NodeContext: a loudly whispered aside, angry

Volo_FestivitiesArea_22.speaker: Gribbo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_22.text: C'mon, pigeon. Back to your cage.
Volo_FestivitiesArea_22.context: NodeContext: the 'pigeon' is Volo, a captive human. Annoyed

Volo_FestivitiesArea_19.speaker: Player
Volo_FestivitiesArea_19.text: Continue rhyming. 'For a soul's not been truer than the Ragzlin named Dror...'

Volo_FestivitiesArea_2.speaker: Gribbo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_2.text: Huh. That was good, carry it on, pigeon.

Volo_FestivitiesArea_43.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_43.text: Um... Hah... '... And if you saw him kill manlings, you'd have to yell...' ahem... 'proooaaaar!'

Volo_FestivitiesArea_23.speaker: Player
Volo_FestivitiesArea_23.text: Is that really the best you can do?

Volo_FestivitiesArea_46.speaker: Player
Volo_FestivitiesArea_46.text: 'I heard Ragzlin casts shadows that are 20 leagues wide!'

Volo_FestivitiesArea_3.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_3.text: Um... 'Why...' Err... 'He's a meatier creature than any I've spied!' Oh, balderdash...

Volo_FestivitiesArea_1.speaker: Gribbo
Volo_FestivitiesArea_1.text: Oi, stranger, you meddlin' with my pigeon? He's talking stupid now.

Volo_Massacre_19.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_19.text: My friend! Are you responsible for the slaughter of these goblins?
Volo_Massacre_19.context: NodeContext: delighted to see us - asking about the slaughter with intense curiosity

Volo_Massacre_36.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_36.text: Indeed - I poisoned the lot of them.

Volo_Massacre_3.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_3.text: Never mind that - what are you doing, picking over corpses?

Volo_Massacre_23.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_23.text: There! That's the last frothing innard catalogued.
Volo_Massacre_23.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre_6.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_6.text: Best not to hang around. Whoever is responsible for this mess may still be here... unless this was your doing?
Volo_Massacre_6.context: NodeContext: polite advice on first sentence, and then a warning. The final phrase is a mixture of curiosity and awe

Volo_Massacre_40.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_40.text: You? Why? And how? But wait, wait - let me get a fresh quill. Now. You were saying?
Volo_Massacre_40.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre_2.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_2.text: The goblins were a threat to a group of tieflings nearby. I put an end to that threat.

Volo_Massacre_11.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_11.text: Ah, but you must mean Zevlor and the lot! I spent some time with them myself. Kind, if underfortunate people.
Volo_Massacre_11.context: NodeContext: pleased - Zevlor (Zev-lore); 'underfortunate' is an intentional nonsense word that he uses pompously to expand his vocabulary

Volo_Massacre_28.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_28.text: It's no wonder you'd endeavour to help them. Still, it's quite an... quite an impressive cost of goblin life.
Volo_Massacre_28.context: NodeContext: impressed but shocked by what we've done (killed a lot of goblins)

Volo_Massacre_18.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_18.text: Of course, my friend. But facts belong to no one and everyone. Please: what happened here?
Volo_Massacre_18.context: NodeContext: inquisitive journalistic type, prodding for answers

Volo_Massacre_7.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_7.text: It was self-defence, I had no choice.

Volo_Massacre_38.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_38.text: You poor soul. These goblins were spoiling for a fight under the banner of their so-called 'Absolute.'
Volo_Massacre_38.context: NodeContext: mock sympathy - he's talking to somebody who claimed they massacred an entire camp of goblins in self-defense and is a little doubtful. But the goblins' new god, the Absolute, is intriguing to him and he'd like to follow up on that

Volo_Massacre_44.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_44.text: Never mind. What are you doing here anyway - looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre_34.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_34.text: Just nosing out the facts. Something happened here, and it's my job - my calling - to discover what.
Volo_Massacre_34.context: NodeContext: arrogant - his 'calling' (at this moment, asking annoying questions) is the most important thing in the world as far as he sees it

Volo_Massacre_5.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_5.text: But if you won't tell me, no matter. A truth is second best to the truth.
Volo_Massacre_5.context: NodeContext: journalistic type who is more interested in a good story than a true story

Volo_Massacre_26.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_26.text: Hmmm... Your story may be relevant, but the stench of this place is hardly suited to civilised conversation.
Volo_Massacre_26.context: NodeContext: politely trying to tag along with the players

Volo_Massacre_35.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_35.text: I wonder if we might continue this elsewhere. You've a brain I'd like to pick.

Volo_Massacre_8.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_8.text: Find me at my camp - we can talk there.

Volo_Massacre_48.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_48.text: Smashing! Ta for now, my friend - only for now!
Volo_Massacre_48.context: NodeContext: delighted to be invited to join the players' camp

Volo_Massacre_10.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_10.text: Pick a different brain. I can't help you.

Volo_Massacre_33.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_33.text: I'll be no trouble, my friend. Name a location and I'd be happy to meet you there.

Volo_Massacre_45.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_45.text: Indeed, the poisoning was my handiwork.

Volo_Massacre_25.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_25.text: Someone must collect the facts and arrange them in a clever order.

Volo_Massacre_27.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_27.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.
Volo_Massacre_27.context: NodeContext: arrogance, introducing himself with a flourish

Volo_Massacre_46.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_46.text: Tell me - did you see what happened here?
Volo_Massacre_46.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre_29.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_29.text: I did. I killed them all.

Volo_Massacre_49.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre_49.text: Never mind that - what are you doing? Looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre_9.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_9.text: Drat. Then I suppose I'll have to stitch together the truth with naught but my own good sense.
Volo_Massacre_9.context: NodeContext: only a little annoyed - 'stitching together the truth' is a chance to impress, and he's keen to do that

Volo_Massacre_42.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_42.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre_47.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre_47.text: My friend! Are you responsible for the state of these unfortunate souls?
Volo_Massacre_47.context: NodeContext: delighted to see us - asking about the dead goblins (they were poisoned, hence 'frothing innards') with intense curiosity

Volo_InCage_0.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_0.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

Volo_InCage_37.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_37.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

Volo_InCage_65.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_65.text: How did you end up in this place?

Volo_InCage_62.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_62.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

Volo_InCage_76.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_76.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

Volo_InCage_31.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_31.text: All right - I'll get you out.

Volo_InCage_4.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_4.text: Bless you, my friend! I'll wait nicely, but please don't tarry!

Volo_InCage_45.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_45.text: I'll think about it. No promises.

Volo_InCage_36.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_36.text: I don't need a promise, my friend. Only an honest attempt. Please - do consider it!

Volo_InCage_2.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_2.text: What career could possibly involve getting locked up by goblins?

Volo_InCage_75.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_75.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

Volo_InCage_38.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_38.text: And you expect me to help you in return for nothing?

Volo_InCage_54.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_54.text: Of course not! As compensation, I can assure the tale of your heroism will live on... forever!

Volo_InCage_67.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_67.text: And just how do you propose doing that?

Volo_InCage_73.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_73.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

Volo_InCage_41.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_41.text: Help me, and I'll make sure everyone in Faerûn knows you for the hero you are.

Volo_InCage_70.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_70.text: That's all? Hardly seems worth the trouble.

Volo_InCage_82.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_82.text: Then please, a favour - notable figure to notable figure.

Volo_InCage_53.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_53.text: You may not recognise me in these dire straits, but my name is Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker.

Volo_InCage_42.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_42.text: Open this cell and I'll never forget the kindness!

Volo_InCage_28.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_28.text: I'm not interested in that sort of attention.

Volo_InCage_60.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_60.text: I'll write an anonymous account of your largesse, then! None will know your name, yet your doings will live on!

Volo_InCage_30.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_30.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

Volo_InCage_46.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_46.text: Why... of course! You were the one with the... name!

Volo_InCage_7.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_7.text: We met in the druids' grove, don't you remember?

Volo_InCage_22.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_22.text: Ah, of course. Good thing we cleared out of there, by the by. These goblins are planning a raid on the place as we speak.

Volo_InCage_19.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_19.text: But! No matter. Here I am and here you are. Please - unlock this cell and we can both of us escape.

Volo_InCage_14.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_14.text: You're Volo, right? I've read your work.

Volo_InCage_16.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_16.text: Aha! An individual of some learning, I see. You're quite right.

Volo_InCage_79.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_79.text: Well, I will be at your service. Once I've been freed from this ensconsement. Speaking of which...

Volo_InCage_11.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_11.text: Gods bless you, friend. I'll wait 'til the coast is quite clear and be gone!
Volo_InCage_11.context: InternalNodeContext: Volo has been freed and is waiting for player to leave the region so he can disappear out of sight.

Volo_InCage_12.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_12.text: Ah! My friend! We can speak freely.

Volo_InCage_15.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_15.text: Ha-HA! I knew I could count on you, my friend.
Volo_InCage_15.context: InternalNodeContext: The cage is unlocked. Player talked to Volo prior to unlocking the cage.

Volo_InCage_43.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_43.text: We mustn't tarry, but I'd hate for our friendship to end here. Please - won't you meet me, once we've both slipped the goblin yoke?

Volo_InCage_35.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_35.text: A fine mess you landed yourself in. How'd you get caught?

Volo_InCage_69.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_69.text: Why, by design, my friend. How better to learn the ways of a people than to live among them?

Volo_InCage_71.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_71.text: I daresay the experiment has proven most fruitful, too. I'll be happy to share my findings... once we've found somewhere safe to parley.

Volo_InCage_8.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_8.text: Slip the yoke? How do you intend to do that exactly?

Volo_InCage_58.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_58.text: An invisibility potion, my friend. A bit less refined than your mendacious methods, but by god it'll do the trick!

Volo_InCage_6.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_6.text: I'm not looking for extra company right now. You go your way, I go mine.

Volo_InCage_20.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_20.text: Pish posh! Allies are a difficult find in the area, my friend. You'll want Volo in your corner, believe you me.

Volo_InCage_72.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_72.text: Go to my camp. We'll talk there, once we're both safe.

Volo_InCage_10.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_10.text: Smashing! Soon, my friend - soon we can share a flagon of something liquid and a tale of derring-do!

Volo_InCage_51.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_51.text: I'll slip away when the coast is clear. See you soon, my friend! I simply can't wait to pick your brain!

Volo_InCage_39.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_39.text: Well, I suppose this is 'goodbye,' my friend. I wish you the greatest of luck and I hope I shall recall you favourably in my records of the day's events.

Volo_InCage_56.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_56.text: I'll slip away when the coast is clear. And I wish you the greatest possible luck in your mysterious endeavours. Ta!

Volo_InCage_17.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_17.text: Ha-HA! Hang the key - I see you've no need at all! Thank you for your help, my friend.
Volo_InCage_17.context: InternalNodeContext: Player got Volo out of the cage (teleport i.e.) and talked to him prior to releasing.

Volo_InCage_34.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_34.text: This lock, my friend! Surely a strong arm like you can make short work of it.

Volo_InCage_78.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_78.text: Ha-HA! Look at this - I'm quite saved, and by means most extraordinary!
Volo_InCage_78.context: InternalNodeContext: Player got Volo out of the cage (teleport i.e.) and DIDN'T talked to him prior to releasing.

Volo_InCage_32.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_32.text: A joy to see a familiar face in such a... precarious setting.

Volo_InCage_1.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_1.text: I guarantee the story of your daring rescue of my person will live on for aeons!

Volo_InCage_83.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_83.text: And just how will you be accomplishing that?

Volo_InCage_57.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_57.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

Volo_InCage_3.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_3.text: Once I've written you into one of my books, there won't be a tavern in Faerûn you can enter without receiving a hero's welcome.

Volo_InCage_25.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_25.text: I'm not looking for that sort of attention.

Volo_InCage_21.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_21.text: I'll write an anonymous account of your heroism, then! None will know your name, yet your doings will live on!

Volo_InCage_64.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_64.text: Volothamp Geddarm, realm-renowned author, auteur, and tastemaker, at your service.

Volo_InCage_27.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_27.text: Get yourself to safety - and quick.

Volo_InCage_18.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_18.text: I intend to do just that. A trusty invisibility potion goes a long way in a place like this.

Volo_InCage_61.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_61.text: We mustn't tarry, but I'd hate for our friendship to end here. Please - won't you meet me, once we've both slipped the goblin yoke?

Volo_InCage_26.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_26.text: You know what else lives on for aeons? Gold. You owe me.

Volo_InCage_29.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_29.text: Bah, what's a bit of metal between allies? I'll do one better.

Volo_InCage_33.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_33.text: Tell me where we can meet each other, once we've slipped the goblin yoke, and I'll offer much more than gold. Knowledge, my friend, is priceless.

Volo_InCage_40.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage_40.text: Remember my name when you're crediting the story's author. It's [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53].

Volo_InCage_77.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_77.text: That will sound ridiculous. But, fine. If you insist. As much as it pains me to cede creative control...

Volo_InCage_80.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage_80.text: Ha-HA! Look at this - I'm quite saved!
Volo_InCage_80.context: InternalNodeContext: The cage is unlocked. Player DIDN'T talked to Volo prior to unlocking the cage.

Guard_AtCage_14.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_14.context: NodeContext: Gribbo doesn't know player's name, so she's saying 'Yourself' as though that's the player's name.

Guard_AtCage_20.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_20.context: NodeContext: Pidge is pronounced as the first syllable of pigeon. thoughtful

Guard_AtCage_21.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_21.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage_21.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage_54.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_54.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage_32.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_32.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage_32.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

Guard_AtCage_44.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_44.text: Your pet is actually a rather famous writer.

Guard_AtCage_4.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_4.context: NodeContext: dismissing a stupid idea presented to her

Guard_AtCage_56.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_56.text: I was admiring him. I'd like one of my own.

Guard_AtCage_57.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_57.text: Then catch one on your own.
Guard_AtCage_57.context: NodeContext: heavy emphasis on 'catch' - she's telling us to catch our own pet rather than taking hers

Guard_AtCage_81.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_81.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

Guard_AtCage_89.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_89.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard_AtCage_9.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_9.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

Guard_AtCage_35.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_35.text: Withholding prisoners? Your boss won't be happy to hear that.

Guard_AtCage_38.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_38.text: What?! I... I ain't. Minthara don't give a cake what you think.

Guard_AtCage_61.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_61.text: Bah. Just take him, if you care so much. See if he'll sing for the likes of you though. Bloody fink.

Guard_AtCage_50.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_50.text: I've taken a shine to this one. How much do you want for him?

Guard_AtCage_29.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_29.text: More'n you've got, mate. I likes him.

Guard_AtCage_3.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_3.text: But, erm, how much do ya got?

Guard_AtCage_60.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_60.text: Eh! I could buy a bagoolion pigeons with that much!

Guard_AtCage_26.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_26.text: Please. You ain't got that much. Look at that state of you.

Guard_AtCage_27.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_27.text: Eh! I could buy twelve pigeons with that much!

Guard_AtCage_55.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_55.text: Please. You ain't got that much. Look at that state of you.

Guard_AtCage_76.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_76.text: Pigeon's worth more'n that times a bagoolion.

Guard_AtCage_67.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_67.text: Offer as little as you can spare. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Guard_AtCage_85.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_85.text: You funnin'? Pigeon don't take a kra-kra for that much.
Guard_AtCage_85.context: NodeContext: irritated and amused: 'kra-kra' pronounced 'craw-craw'. Means poop.

Guard_AtCage_48.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_48.text: Offer a bulging bag of fake gold.

Guard_AtCage_77.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_77.text: Eh! I could buy a bagoolion pigeons with that much!

Guard_AtCage_79.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_79.text: Actually, I have no coin to spare.

Guard_AtCage_72.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_72.text: See? You couldn't take care of him proper anyway.

Guard_AtCage_93.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_93.text: Y-yes, of course - I didn't realise who you was.

Guard_AtCage_94.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_94.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

Guard_AtCage_92.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_92.text: Here's the key. Pigeon's all yours.
Guard_AtCage_92.context: InternalNodeContext: Gribbo should hand player the key to Volo's cageNodeContext: matter of fact

Guard_AtCage_52.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_52.text: Huh?! It were right in my pocket... someone musta nicked it! Bloody maggots.
Guard_AtCage_52.context: NodeContext: shocked to have been pickpocketed

Guard_AtCage_23.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_23.text: Here's the key. Pigeon's all yours.
Guard_AtCage_23.context: InternalNodeContext: Gribbo should hand player the key to Volo's cageNodeContext: matter of fact

Guard_AtCage_46.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_46.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

Guard_AtCage_42.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_42.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

Guard_AtCage_86.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_86.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

Guard_AtCage_78.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_78.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

Guard_AtCage_73.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_73.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

Guard_AtCage_84.speaker: Narrator
Guard_AtCage_84.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

Guard_AtCage_31.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_31.text: He looks weak. Sick, even. He won't last long in there.

Guard_AtCage_80.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_80.text: Take him for a jog, why don't ya. And don't let the lads snatch him up. No tellin' what they'll do to him.

Guard_AtCage_0.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_0.text: Bring him back when he's all tuckered out.

Guard_AtCage_6.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_6.text: I'm done talking. Open the cage or you'll be sorry.

Guard_AtCage_25.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_25.text: All right, all right, calm down. I don't wants no trouble.

Guard_AtCage_39.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_39.context: NodeContext: hard g on ranga (RAN-GAH) - obstinately deflecting a threat

Guard_AtCage_51.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_51.text: Watch your tongue, or I'll take it.

Guard_AtCage_75.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_75.text: This ranga better not go yappin' 'bout my pigeon. I shoulda turned him over to Minthara by now, but he's such a nice little pigeon.
Guard_AtCage_75.context: NodeContext: internal monologue as we read her mind - 'ranga' with a hard g (RAN-GAH). defensive

Guard_AtCage_15.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_15.context: NodeContext: She'll go hostile now, reacting to player trying to read her mind (and failing).

Guard_AtCage_70.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_70.text: I hate to see such a lovely creature in a cage.

Guard_AtCage_68.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_68.text: Ehh, he don't mind. Keeps him safe from me mates! Raids make 'em rabid.
Guard_AtCage_68.context: NodeContext: reassuring herself as much as us

Guard_AtCage_5.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage_5.text: Does your bird have a name?

Guard_AtCage_91.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_91.context: NodeContext: thinking on the spot - 'Pidge' is the name she's just come up with for her captive (pronounced as the first syllable of 'pigeon')

Guard_AtCage_22.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage_22.context: NodeContext: The guard interrupts my convo with Volo; I shouldn't be disturbing him! He's being sarcastic about Volo being the talent, but not about you not bothering him.
